posts.post_content:
Dad and I are trying to put together a relatively nice looking crease-free T206 set for $50k.  Think along the lines of vg/ex minimum raw (please no trimmed cards). Okay if it's $60k that might work too :)

So... looking for large raw lots in decent shape (do these even exist anymore)?

Interesting note: We've done this type of project around a dozen times over the past 30 years...but it was MUCH easier in the 1980s

Email me what you all have along with asking prices.  Not looking for singles at this point unless they are Cobb or Demmitt/O'Hara.   

Email: [url]Scottglevy@yahoo.com[/url]

Still need 520.   

Note: Not going after the Wagner, Plank, 
Doyle or Magie for this project.
4 down... 520 to go... did you get the 4 Cobb's

[quote name="VintageBen" post=1648396]4 down... 520 to go... did you get the 4 Cobb's[/QUOTE]

I think he's saying he still needs all of them, except Doyle, Magie, Plank and Wagner.

[quote name="T206Collector" post=1648450]I think he's saying he still needs all of them, except Doyle, Magie, Plank and Wagner.[/QUOTE]

Yea it would be impossible to get those 4 as well and stay within the $50-60k range. Maybe they will find those rare 4 in a brown paper bag in a relative's attic.

[quote name="VintageBen" post=1648650]Yea it would be impossible to get those 4 as well and stay within the $50-60k range. Maybe they will find those rare 4 in a brown paper bag in a relative's attic.[/QUOTE]

I actually think if you were looking for a true VG-Ex, there Magie is the only single card you could get for under $50K on that list.
